intro: Janusia anisandra, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family, characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its small, pale blue to violet flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Janusia anisandra is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, demonstrating its ecological significance in these regions.
